block.p: By one measure, at least, the future of America seems to be at the gambling table. The Census Bureau estimated that jobs in Las Vegas lured so many people that Nevada grew the fastest of any state in the 1990's, with its population rising 50 percent. Many of those pouring in to build or staff casinos and hotels were Hispanics and Asians, the nation's fastest-growing minority groups. California, though, still has the largest Hispanic population -- 10.4 million, up 36 percent in a decade.
